about.bugReport: File a bug report or request a feature:
about.description1: TMI (Threat Modeling Improved) is a collaborative platform for managing an organization's security review process, including threat modeling. Our mission is to reduce the toil of security reviewing, and to make threat modeling accessible, efficient, and integrated into the software development lifecycle.
about.description2: The platform features security review organization and state management, interactive data flow diagram creation with real-time collaboration, and comprehensive threat documentation capabilities. Built with modern web technologies, TMI helps teams manage the security review process and identify, analyze, and mitigate security threats through collaborative modeling.

opensource.paragraph1: This application is built with the support of exceptional open-source projects. We're grateful to the communities behind these projects for providing the capabilities that bring our interface and functionality to life.
opensource.paragraph2: A special thanks for providing inspiration that helped shape our vision and approach to building a secure and user-friendly application goes to

about.title: TMIについて
about.trademarks: すべての製品名、ロゴ、およびブランドは、それぞれの所有者の財産です。このアプリケーションで使用されているすべての企業名、製品名、およびサービス名は、識別目的のためにのみ使用されています。これらの名前、ロゴ、およびブランドの使用は、承認を意味するものではありません。

homeDescription: A collaborative threat modeling tool designed to help teams identify, analyze, and document security threats in their systems. Create, share, and collaboratively edit threat models and diagrams to improve your application security.
homeWelcomeTitle: TMIへようこそ: 脅威モデリング改善版

login.explanation: Sign in with your existing account from a trusted identity provider. This eliminates the need for a separate password, streamlining your experience while keeping you secure. We never store or manage passwords—your credentials stay with your provider and can't be compromised through us.

privacy.changesContent: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. Any changes will be posted on this page with an updated "Last Updated" date.
privacy.complianceContent: We will only disclose information if required to do so by law, such as in response to a valid government order or subpoena. In such cases, The Operator will comply with applicable legal obligations.

contactContent.part1: If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please feel free to contact the Operator of this web site via the contact information on the

privacy.dataSecurityContent1: The Operator implements industry-standard security measures to protect your personal data, including encryption in transit and at rest, secure authentication protocols, and regular security updates. Access to your information is restricted to authorized personnel on a need-to-know basis.
privacy.dataSecurityContent2: While no system is entirely impervious to risks, The Operator continuously monitors and updates safeguards to mitigate threats and ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of your data.
privacy.dataSharingContent1: The Operator does not share your personal information with any third parties, except in the following limited circumstances:
privacy.dataSharingContent2: Beyond these exceptions, The Operator does not sell, rent, or share your data with any other entities for marketing, advertising, or any other purpose.
privacy.dataSharingList1: Service Providers: Your data may be stored and processed on secure third-party cloud infrastructure (such as AWS, Google Cloud, or similar providers) solely to operate and maintain the application. These providers are contractually obligated to protect your data and use it only for the purposes The Operator specifies.
privacy.dataSharingList2: Legal Compliance: The Operator may disclose information if required by law, such as in response to a valid court order, subpoena, or government request.
privacy.informationCollectionContent1: When users authenticate via social login (using OAuth or OpenID Connect providers such as Sign in with Google, Login with GitHub, Microsoft Entra External ID, or others), the application collects the following information from the selected provider, solely to facilitate authentication and provide personalized services:
privacy.informationCollectionContent2: No additional personal data is collected without explicit user consent. The Operator does not access or store sensitive information such as passwords, contacts, or other provider-specific data beyond what is necessary for authentication. All collected information is handled in accordance with the respective provider's API policies and The Operator's commitment to user privacy.
privacy.informationCollectionList1: Basic Profile Information: Full name, email address, and profile picture (if provided and available).
privacy.informationCollectionList2: Unique Identifier: A provider-specific user ID to manage account sessions securely.

intro1.part1: This web site is an instance of an open-source web application ("TMI") that is made available by the Operator listed on the
intro1.part2: page of this web site ("The Operator").

privacy.intro2: The Operator is committed to protecting your privacy. This Privacy Policy explains how your information is handled.
privacy.title: プライバシーポリシー
privacy.userRightsContent1: You have full control over your personal data. At any time, you may access the "Delete All My Data" feature in the User Preferences section of the application.
privacy.userRightsContent2: This option enables immediate deletion of all data The Operator stores on your behalf, including profile information and authentication records. Upon activation, your data will be permanently removed from The Operator's systems and third-party providers, subject to any legal retention obligations.

sessionExpiry.message: Your session is about to expire. Would you like to extend your session or log out now?
sessionExpiry.title: セッションがまもなく期限切れになります

threatPriority.0.description: Must be addressed urgently; active exploitation, regulatory violation, or critical business exposure.
threatPriority.1.description: Requires prompt resolution; high-risk exposure or upcoming release deadline.
threatPriority.2.description: Address within standard development cycles; moderate exposure.
threatPriority.3.description: Include in backlog for future cycles; no immediate exposure.
threatPriority.4.description: Postponed with documented business approval; tracked but not scheduled.

threatSeverity.0.description: Exploitable vulnerability enables complete system compromise, data breach, or safety impact; requires immediate action.
threatSeverity.1.description: Significant impact or high likelihood; enables major unauthorized access, privilege escalation, or service disruption.
threatSeverity.2.description: Moderate impact or likelihood; limited data exposure, partial functionality impairment, or requires chained exploits.
threatSeverity.3.description: Minimal impact or low likelihood; negligible business impact, requires specific conditions or user interaction.
threatSeverity.4.description: No direct exploitability; recommendation, best practice deviation, or configuration improvement.
threatSeverity.5.description: Threat severity has not yet been assessed.

threatStatus.0.description: The finding has been identified and documented but no action has been initiated.
threatStatus.1.description: The threat has been validated as legitimate through analysis or evidence.
threatStatus.2.description: A remediation or mitigation strategy has been defined and assigned.
threatStatus.3.description: Implementation of controls, code changes, or countermeasures is underway.
threatStatus.4.description: Mitigation is complete; security team must test or review effectiveness.
threatStatus.5.description: The threat is fully mitigated and verified; residual risk is acceptable.
threatStatus.6.description: The threat is acknowledged but intentionally not mitigated (e.g., due to business justification); requires formal risk acceptance.
threatStatus.7.description: Investigation determined the finding is not a valid threat; no further action required.
threatStatus.8.description: Action is postponed with approval (e.g., for future sprints); includes rationale and due date.
threatStatus.9.description: The finding is archived after resolution, acceptance, or invalidation, with audit trail.

status.0.tooltip: The security review has been initiated but no assessment activities have begun.
status.1.tooltip: Active assessment is underway, including threat modeling, code review, or testing.
status.2.tooltip: Assessment artifacts (e.g., reports, findings) await formal review by security leads or approvers.
status.3.tooltip: Vulnerabilities or issues have been identified; development must address them.
status.4.tooltip: Fixes for identified issues are being implemented by the development team.
status.5.tooltip: Remediation is complete; security team must verify effectiveness.
status.6.tooltip: All issues are resolved and verified; the application meets security criteria for release or deployment.
status.7.tooltip: The review failed critical criteria; significant rework is required before re-submission.
status.8.tooltip: The review is paused (e.g., due to resource constraints or application changes); resumption is planned.
status.9.tooltip: The review is fully completed and archived, with no further action needed.

tooltips.assetsCardTitle: Assets are valuable resources within the system that require protection, such as data, hardware, software, infrastructure, services, or personnel.
tooltips.diagramsCardTitle: Diagrams in TMI are machine-readable representations of data movement and processes within a system, enabling both manual and automated security analysis.
tooltips.documentsCardTitle: Document references are links to documents stored outside TMI. Relevant documents describe the system to be analyzed, and can be used by both security analysts and automated analysis processes.
tooltips.notesCardTitle: Notes are markdown format text that is completely contained within the threat model, used to capture notes and annotation from security analysts and automated analysis processes.
tooltips.repositoriesCardTitle: Repositories are links to Source Code Repositories where source code for the system is managed.
tooltips.threatsCardTitle: Threats are potential adverse events or action that exploits a vulnerability or weakness in a system to compromise its confidentiality, integrity, availability, or other security objectives. In TMI, threat objects also contain information about the type and level of risk associated with the threat and information to track the work needed to mitigate the threat.

content.part2: page of this web site. Your use of the software is subject to its open-source license terms. We are not responsible for the software itself, only for operating this instance. Unless stated otherwise, the Operator of this web site is not affiliated with the TMI project or its creators.

section6.content: The Operator may update these Terms at any time. Continued use of the web site after changes constitutes acceptance of the updated Terms.

deleteMyData.confirmation: Are you sure that you want to delete all your data?

explanation.bullet1: Your Identity Provider data, including user ID, name, and email.
explanation.bullet2: Your permissions from all threat model objects that you do not own.
explanation.bullet3a: If other owners exist, ownership will transfer to them, and your permissions will be revoked.
explanation.bullet3b: If no other owners exist, the threat model along with all associated diagrams, threat data, metadata, and references will be irrevocably deleted.
explanation.intro: Confirming this operation will permanently delete the following data and revoke associated permissions:
